channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: NPR's 'Code Switch': Joy as Resistance
item.description: Leah Donnella of NPR's Code Switch has spent some time unpacking what it would mean for joy to be used as a means of resistance.
item.content:encoded: Leah Donnella of NPR's Code Switch has spent some time unpacking what it would mean for joy to be used as a means of resistance.
item.dc:creator: Leah Donnella

item.title: 'The Rest of Our Lives' takes readers on a midlife crisis road trip
item.description: America's literary highways may be plenty crowded with middle-aged runaways fleeing lives that increasingly feel like a bad fit. But Ben Markovits adds a moving tale to the collection.
item.content:encoded: America's literary highways may be plenty crowded with middle-aged runaways fleeing lives that increasingly feel like a bad fit. But Ben Markovits adds a moving tale to the collection.
item.dc:creator: Heller McAlpin

item.title: Hunker down with these 13 mysteries and thrillers from 2025
item.description: Mysteries and thrillers are enjoyable no matter the season, but there's something extra satisfying about curling up in the winter with a warm drink and an all-engrossing read. Here's what we suggest.
item.content:encoded: Mysteries and thrillers are enjoyable no matter the season, but there's something extra satisfying about curling up in the winter with a warm drink and an all-engrossing read. Here's what we suggest.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: The cultural works becoming public domain in 2026, from Betty Boop to Nancy Drew
item.description: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, share and remake starting on Jan. 1.
item.content:encoded: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, share and remake starting on Jan. 1.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Amanda Seyfried's tally for 2025: 3 starring roles, 2 Golden Globe nominations
item.description: Amanda Seyfried is up for a Golden Globe for her performance in The Testament of Ann Lee, a movie musical about the leader of the Shakers, the 18th-century religious movement that preached celibacy, gender and racial equality, and pacifism.
item.content:encoded:
Amanda Seyfried is up for a Golden Globe for her performance in The Testament of Ann Lee, a movie musical about the leader of the Shakers, the 18th-century religious movement that preached celibacy, gender and racial equality, and pacifism.

(Image credit: Searchlight Pictures/Searchlight Pictures)
item.dc:creator: Phil Harrell

item.title: 'We have to speak, we have to shout': Jane Fonda is still an activist
item.description: Earlier this year, Fonda made headlines for delivering a fiery critique of the Trump administration during an acceptance speech for a SAG-AFTRA award. Originally broadcast Sept. 2, 2025.
item.content:encoded: Earlier this year, Fonda made headlines for delivering a fiery critique of the Trump administration during an acceptance speech for a SAG-AFTRA award. Originally broadcast Sept. 2, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Shonda Rhimes used to feel a disconnect between her and her characters
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. "Grey's Anatomy" creator Shonda Rhimes talks about why she doesn't care about validation.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. "Grey's Anatomy" creator Shonda Rhimes talks about why she doesn't care about validation.

item.title: A neighbor's Christmas gift that keeps on giving
item.description: In the days leading up to Christmas 2018, the Williams family were told that their neighbor had passed away. He left behind a sack of 14 gifts for Cadi Williams to be opened each year on Christmas.
item.content:encoded: In the days leading up to Christmas 2018, the Williams family were told that their neighbor had passed away. He left behind a sack of 14 gifts for Cadi Williams to be opened each year on Christmas.
item.dc:creator: John Ketchum

item.title: The real ping pong champion — and hustler — who inspired 'Marty Supreme'
item.description: Marty Reisman was nicknamed "The Needle" for his slender physique. He dressed well and put on a show.
item.content:encoded:
Marty Reisman was nicknamed "The Needle" for his slender physique. He dressed well and put on a show.

(Image credit: Ed Ford)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Springsteen's label was about to drop him. Then came 'Born to Run'
item.description: Biographer Peter Ames Carlin describes the making of Born to Run as an "existential moment" for Springsteen. Carlin's book is Tonight in Jungleland. Originally broadcast Aug. 7, 2025.
item.content:encoded: Biographer Peter Ames Carlin describes the making of Born to Run as an "existential moment" for Springsteen. Carlin's book is Tonight in Jungleland. Originally broadcast Aug. 7, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross
